newsitem.title: FRANCE: Morocco wheat tender for September 7-15 arrival.
newsitem.headline: Morocco wheat tender for September 7-15 arrival.

text.p: Morocco's relaunched tender for 90,000 tonnes of soft wheat is for grain to be delivered between September 7 and 15, European grain traders said.
Morocco launched the tender after postponing a previous one for 120,000 tonnes to be delivered in August and September, of which 30,000 was to have been delivered in August.
The quantity on that tender was subsequently revised up to 130,000 tonnes.
Traders said Rabat had received offers mostly in the low $150s per tonne including freight.
The new tender is for optional-origin soft wheat to be paid under U.S. GSM or French Coface government-backed credit or with cash. Offers are due by 3.30 p.m. (1530 GMT) on August 12.
European and American traders said U.S. wheat had the best chance of competing for the tender, with French wheat kept uncompetitive for nearby months partly by European Union taxes.
Traders gave the following breakdown of deliveries by Moroccan port outlined in the new import tender.
